application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: 1647 London Plane: Reduce drooping lateral limb projecting west at 12m by approx 4m, beyond historical wound to a suitable growth point. 1650 London Plane: Reduce central stem with decay by approx. 3 to 4 metres in height and reduce the remaining crown by up to 2m. 1465 London Plane: Initiate a high pollard at approx. 12m. 1536 Deodar Cedar: Selected lateral reduction by 1 to 1.5m ensuring a natural flow to the crown. 1434 London Plane: Reduce height of 3 main laterals above wound area at 14m each by 4-5m back to suitable growth points. 1441 Dawn Redwood: Fell 1459 White Willow: Initiate high pollard at approx. 10 to 12m,retain all lower growth.1451 Bee tree: Fell.3194 Honey Locust: Coppice.1397 London Plane: Reduce limb to north in height by approx. 4m and in spread by approx. 3m back to suitable growth points 339 Acer spp.: Fell.1390 Acer rubrum: remove no more than up to 2 girdling roots not exceeding 50mm diameter only.1161 Hoheria sp.: Reduce crown by up to 3m. 		1668 London Plane: Reduce 2 no. over-extended limbs at 6m and 8m projecting north by up to 2.5m. Reduction of 3 no. upright verticals growing from previous pruning points at approx. 16m growing to east, by 2/2.5m.  1252 False Acacia: Tip reduce laterals by 2m all over and replace bracing 1529 Silver Maple: Reduce over extended main lateral at 2m projecting north-west by up to 2m.
